maml:description.maml:para: Creates scaffolding for a Django application which will be hosted in the cloud via IIS
Creates scaffolding for a Django application which will be hosted in the cloud via IIS

The name of the web role, determines the name of the directory containing the scaffolding for the Django application that will be hosted in the web role, default is WebRole# Where # is the number of web roles in the service
The number of role instances for this web role, default is 1

The name of the web role, determines the name of the directory containing the scaffolding for the Django application that will be hosted in the web role, default is WebRole# Where # is the number of web roles in the service
The number of role instances for this web role, default is 1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a Windows Azure web role with the default configuration (Name = "Webole1", Instances = 1)
Adds scaffolding for a single web role named "MyWebRole" to the current application
Adds scaffolding for a new web role named "MyWebRole" to the current application, with a role instance count of 2

maml:description.maml:para: Disables remote desktop access to a hosted service
Disables remote desktop access to a hosted service. You must publish the service using the Publish-AzureService cmdlet after disabling remote desktop access for the change to take effect.
Enables remote desktop access to a hosted service
Enables remote desktop access to a hosted service. You must publish the service using the Publish-AzureService cmdlet after enabling remote desktop access for the change to take effect.
The username credential you will use when connecting to the azure role instance via RDP. The cmdlet will prompt you for a password.
The username credential you will use when connecting to the azure role instance via RDP. The cmdlet will prompt you for a password.
Creates scaffolding for a Django application which will be hosted in the cloud via IIS
Creates scaffolding for a Django application which will be hosted in the cloud via IIS

The name of the web role, determines the name of the directory containing the scaffolding for the Django application that will be hosted in the web role, default is WebRole# Where # is the number of web roles in the service
The number of role instances for this web role, default is 1

The name of the web role, determines the name of the directory containing the scaffolding for the Django application that will be hosted in the web role, default is WebRole# Where # is the number of web roles in the service
The number of role instances for this web role, default is 1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a Windows Azure web role with the default configuration (Name = "Webole1", Instances = 1)
Adds scaffolding for a single web role named "MyWebRole" to the current application
Adds scaffolding for a new web role named "MyWebRole" to the current application, with a role instance count of 2

maml:description.maml:para: Downloads a Windows Azure Publish Profile to your local computer
Opens a browser window to download a Windows Azure Publish Profile containing the settings necessary to publish your applications to the cloud

dev:remarks.maml:para: Download a Windows Azure Publish Profile from the Windows Azure portal

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves and displays storage account details for the specified Azure subscription. If no subscription is specified, uses the first subscription in your Azure publish profile

Retrieves and displays the name, primary key, and secondary key for all active storage accounts associated with the specified subscription. If no subscription is specified, uses the first subscription listed in the current Azure publish profile
Azure subscription name.
Azure subscription name.
Imports the Publish Profile to enable publishing to Azure and managing hosted services
Imports the certificate information required for publishing your service to the cloud from the specified Windows Azure publish profile. Settings only need to be imported once.
The path to your Windows Azure publish profile. A publish profile can be downloaded using the Get-AzurePublishSettings commandlet
The path to your Windows Azure publish profile. A publish profile can be downloaded using the Get-AzurePublishSettings commandlet

dev:remarks.maml:para: Imports Windows Azure publishing settings from the file "MyPublishSettings.publishsettings" in the current directory

maml:description.maml:para: Creates scaffolding for a new service
Creates the necessary files and configuration for a new Windows Azure service in the current directory

The name of the service - determines the leftmost portion of the hostname for your service (i.e. <Name>.cloudapp.net), and the directory that will contain your service. Must contain only letters, digits, and the dash character (-).

The name of the service - determines the leftmost portion of the hostname for your service (i.e. <Name>.cloudapp.net), and the directory that will contain your service. Must contain only letters, digits, and the dash character (-).

dev:remarks.maml:para: Create scaffolding for a new Windows Azure service named "MyService1" in the current directory.

maml:description.maml:para: Publish the current service to the cloud

Publish the current service to the cloud. Publishing settings (Name, Subscription, StorageAccountName, Location, Slot) can be specified on the command line, or in local settings via one of the Set-Azure* commands.

The Windows Azure subscription name to be used while deploying this service. If no Subscription parameter is specified, the value will be taken from the last Set-AzureDeploymentSubscription command issued for this service, or, if no subscription was ever specified, it will default to the first subscription listed in the current windows Azure publish profile.

The name to be used for the service when publishing to the cloud. The name determines the subdomain label in the cloudapp.net subdomain that will be used to address the service when hosted in Azure (that is, <Name>.cloudapp.net). Any name specified while publishing the service will override the name given when creating the service (see the New-AzureService commandlet) or by subsequent calls to the Set-AzureServiceName commandlet.

The Windows Azure storage account name to be used while publishing the service to the cloud. This value is not used until the service is published to the cloud. If no storage account name is provided, the storage account specified by the last call to Set-AzureDeploymentStorageAccount will be used. If no storage account was ever specified, a storage account matching the name of the service will be used. If no such storage account exists, the commandlet will attempt to create a new one - this may fail if a storage account matching the service name exists in another subscription.

The region in which the application will be hosted. Possible values are: Anywhere Asia, Anywhere Europe, Anywhere US, East Asia, North Central US, North Europe, South Central US, Southeast Asia, West Europe. If no Location is specified, the location specified in the last call to Set-AzureDeploymentLocation will be used. If no Location was ever specified, the Location will be randomly chosen from 'North Central US' and 'South Central US' locations.

The deployment slot to be used for this service. Possible values are 'Staging' and 'Production'. If no slot is specified, the slot provided in the last call to Set-AzureDeploymentSlot will be used. If no slot was ever specified, the 'Production' slot will be used.
If specified, launch a browser window to view the application after it is deployed to Azure

command:parameter.maml:name: Subscription

maml:description.maml:para: The Windows Azure subscription name to be used while deploying this service. If no Subscription parameter is specified, the value will be taken from the last Set-AzureDeploymentSubscription command issued for this service, or, if no subscription was ever specified, it will default to the first subscription listed in the current windows Azure publish profile.

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: value taken from current service settings or the current publish profile

maml:description.maml:para: The name to be used for the service when publishing to the cloud. The name determines the subdomain label in the cloudapp.net subdomain that will be used to address the service when hosted in Azure (that is, <Name>.cloudapp.net). Any name specified while publishing the service will override the name given when creating the service (see the New-AzureService commandlet) or by subsequent calls to the Set-AzureServiceName commandlet.

command:parameter.maml:name: StorageAccountName

maml:description.maml:para: The Windows Azure storage account name to be used while publishing the service to the cloud. This value is not used until the service is published to the cloud. If no storage account name is provided, the storage account specified by the last call to Set-AzureDeploymentStorageAccount will be used. If no storage account was ever specified, a storage account matching the name of the service will be used. If no such storage account exists, the commandlet will attempt to create a new one - this may fail if a storage account matching the service name exists in another subscription.

command:parameter.dev:defaultValue: Value taken from the current service settings or the current publish profile

maml:description.maml:para: The region in which the application will be hosted. Possible values are: Anywhere Asia, Anywhere Europe, Anywhere US, East Asia, North Central US, North Europe, South Central US, Southeast Asia, West Europe. If no Location is specified, the location specified in the last call to Set-AzureDeploymentLocation will be used. If no Location was ever specified, the Location will be randomly chosen from 'North Central US' and 'South Central US' locations.

The deployment slot to be used for this service. Possible values are 'Staging' and 'Production'. If no slot is specified, the slot provided in the last call to Set-AzureDeploymentSlot will be used. If no slot was ever specified, the 'Production' slot will be used.
If specified, launch a browser window to view the application after it is deployed to Azure

dev:remarks.maml:para: Publishes the current service, using the current service settings and the current Azure publish profile

maml:description.maml:para: Remove the current hosted service
Stop and remove the current hosted service, using the specified subscription name.

The subscription name that was used to host the service. If no subscription is specified, uses the subscription specified in the last call to Set-AzureDeploymentSubscription. If no subscription was ever specified, uses the first subscription in the current Azure publish profile.

The subscription name that was used to host the service. If no subscription is specified, uses the subscription specified in the last call to Set-AzureDeploymentSubscription. If no subscription was ever specified, uses the first subscription in the current Azure publish profile.
Sets the deployment location for the current service
Sets the deployment location for the current service. This value is not needed until the service is published in the cloud.

The region in which the service will be hosted. This value is not used until the service is published to the cloud. Possible values are: Anywhere Asia, Anywhere Europe, Anywhere US, East Asia, North Central US, North Europe, South Central US, Southeast Asia, West Europe

The region in which the service will be hosted. This value is not used until the service is published to the cloud. Possible values are: Anywhere Asia, Anywhere Europe, Anywhere US, East Asia, North Central US, North Europe, South Central US, Southeast Asia, West Europe

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the deployment location for the service to the North Central US region. When the service is subsequently published to the cloud, it will be hosted in a data center in the North Central US region.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the deployment slot for the current service
Sets the deployment slot for the current service. This value is not needed until the service is published in the cloud.
The deployment slot for the application. This value is not used until the service is published to the cloud. Possible values include 'Staging' and 'Production'. 'Production' is the default.
The deployment slot for the application. This value is not used until the service is published to the cloud. Possible values include 'Staging' and 'Production'. 'Production' is the default.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the deployment slot for the application to 'Staging'. When the service is subsequently published to the cloud, the 'Staging' deployment slot will be used.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the storage account to be used when publishing the service to the cloud
Sets the storage account to be used when publishing the service to the cloud. This value is not needed until the service is published in the cloud.
The name of the storage account to be used when publishing the service to the cloud
The name of the storage account to be used when publishing the service to the cloud
Sets the subscription name to be used when publishing the service to the cloud
Sets the subscription name to be used when publishing the service to the cloud. This value is not needed until the service is published in the cloud.
The name of the subscription to use when publishing the service to the cloud
The name of the subscription to use when publishing the service to the cloud
Set the number of instances for the specified role
Sets the number of role instances for the specified role.
The name of the web or worker role that is changing
The number of role instances for the specified web or worker role
The name of the web or worker role that is changing
The number of role instances for the specified web or worker role

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the number of instances for the web role named 'MyWebRole1' to 2
Sets the role instance count for the worker role named "WorkerRole1" to 2

maml:description.maml:para: Starts both the compute and storage emulators and executes the service
Starts both the compute and storage emulators and executes the service
Open a new browser window on the service after executing it in the emulator
Open a new browser window on the service after executing it in the emulator

dev:remarks.maml:para: Executes the service in the Azure emulator and launches a new browser window on the emulated service

maml:description.maml:para: Starts the current hosted service
Starts the current hosted service in the cloud, if the service is in the stopped state. Note that the Publish-AzureService command will attempt to automatically start the service
The deployment slot (Staging, Production) to start the service in
The subscription to use when starting the specified service
The deployment slot (Staging, Production) to start the service in
The subscription to use when starting the specified service
Stops the compute emulator
Stops the Windows Azure compute emulator. Any services currently executing in the emulator will be removed.
Stops the current hosted service
Stops the current hosted service in the specified slot in Windows Azure. If no slot is specified, stops the service in the Production slot
The slot where the service is hosted. If no slot is specified, 'Production' is assumed.
The subscription to use when stopping the specified service.
The slot where the service is hosted. If no slot is specified, 'Production' is assumed.
The subscription to use when stopping the specified service.
